mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Originally designated as the U.S. Post Office and Courthouse, the structure was later renamed the Federal Building and U.S. Courthouse. By July 30, 1899, all departments of the post office were in the new government building. It also housed the U.S. Courts, the U.S. Engineers, and the U.S. Weather Bureau. The U. S. Post Office no longer (1999) occupies the building. The building occupies an entire city block on the western side of Wright Square, bounded by Bull, York, Whitaker, and State streets.The building was enlarged between 1930 and 1932, and was renamed in honor of the Creek Indian leader Tomochichi in 2005. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tomochichi_Federal_Building_and_United_States_Courthouse [work]
